commit_message:
Cinder::VolumeType observe reality implementation

Add override get_live_resource_data and parse_live_resource_data
methods for Cinder::VolumeType resource.

implements bp get-reality-for-resources

Change-Id: I5a75f3814a750f0537c1dae1e81dd03e77acc4cd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/51/250451/15 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from heat.engine.clients.os import cinder as cinderclient def test_volume_type_get_reality_public(self): self.my_volume_type.resource_id = '1234' volume_type = mock.Mock() volume_type._info = {'name': 'test', 'is_public': True, 'description': 'test1', 'metadata': {'one': 'two'}} self.volume_types.get.return_value = volume_type volume_type.get_keys.return_value = {'one': 'two'} volume_type_access = mock.MagicMock() self.cinderclient.volume_type_access = volume_type_access reality = self.my_volume_type._get_reality() expected = { 'name': 'test', 'is_public': True, 'description': 'test1', 'metadata': {'one': 'two'} } self.assertEqual(set(expected.keys()), set(reality.keys())) for key in reality: self.assertEqual(expected[key], reality[key]) self.assertEqual(0, volume_type_access.list.call_count) def test_volume_type_get_reality_not_public(self): self.my_volume_type.resource_id = '1234' volume_type = mock.Mock() volume_type._info = {'name': 'test', 'is_public': False, 'description': 'test1', 'metadata': {'one': 'two'}} self.volume_types.get.return_value = volume_type volume_type.get_keys.return_value = {'one': 'two'} volume_type_access = mock.MagicMock() class Access(object): def __init__(self, idx, project, info): self.volumetype_id = idx self.project_id = project self._info = info volume_type_access.list.return_value = [ Access('1234', '1', {'volumetype_id': '1234', 'project_id': '1'}), Access('1234', '2', {'volumetype_id': '1234', 'project_id': '2'})] self.cinderclient.volume_type_access = volume_type_access reality = self.my_volume_type._get_reality() expected = { 'name': 'test', 'is_public': False, 'description': 'test1', 'metadata': {'one': 'two'}, 'projects': ['1', '2'] } self.assertEqual(set(expected.keys()), set(reality.keys())) for key in reality: self.assertEqual(expected[key], reality[key]) self.assertEqual(1, volume_type_access.list.call_count) def test_volume_type_get_reality_not_found_id(self): self.my_volume_type.resource_id = None self.assertRaises(exception.EntityNotFound, self.my_volume_type._get_reality) def test_volume_type_get_reality_not_found(self): self.my_volume_type.resource_id = '1234' self.volume_types.get.side_effect = [ cinderclient.exceptions.NotFound(404)] self.assertRaises(exception.EntityNotFound, self.my_volume_type._get_reality) def test_volume_type_get_reality_other_error(self): self.my_volume_type.resource_id = '1234' self.volume_types.get.side_effect = [ cinderclient.exceptions.CommandError(500)] self.assertRaises(cinderclient.exceptions.CommandError, self.my_volume_type._get_reality)

commit_message:
EncryptedVolumeType observe reality implement

Add override get_live_resource_data and parse_live_resource_data
methods implementation for Cinder::EncryptedVolumeType resource.

implements bp get-reality-for-resources

Change-Id: I772b10e1b035073a7e40dc99b1a6e9e409b7e3f3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/30/276730/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from heat.common import exception from heat.engine.clients.os import cinder as cinderclient def test_get_live_state(self): self.my_encrypted_vol_type.resource_id = '1234' value = mock.MagicMock() value._info = { 'volume_type_id': '1122', 'provider': 'nova.Test', 'cipher': 'aes-xts-plain64', 'control_location': 'front-end', 'key_size': 256 } self.volume_encryption_types.get.return_value = value with mock.patch.object(self.my_encrypted_vol_type.client_plugin(), 'get_volume_type') as mock_get_volume_type: mock_get_volume_type.side_effect = [ '01bd581d-33fe-4d6d-bd7b-70ae076d39fb', '1122'] reality = self.my_encrypted_vol_type.get_live_state( self.my_encrypted_vol_type.properties) expected = { 'volume_type': '1122', 'provider': 'nova.Test', 'cipher': 'aes-xts-plain64', 'control_location': 'front-end', 'key_size': 256 } self.assertEqual(set(expected.keys()), set(reality.keys())) for key in expected: self.assertEqual(expected[key], reality[key]) def test_get_live_state_several_properties_is_none(self): self.my_encrypted_vol_type.resource_id = '1234' self.my_encrypted_vol_type.properties.data['volume_type'] = 'name' value = mock.MagicMock() value._info = { 'volume_type_id': '1122', 'provider': 'nova.Test', 'control_location': 'front-end' } self.volume_encryption_types.get.return_value = value with mock.patch.object(self.my_encrypted_vol_type.client_plugin(), 'get_volume_type') as mock_get_volume_type: mock_get_volume_type.side_effect = ['1122', '1122'] reality = self.my_encrypted_vol_type.get_live_state( self.my_encrypted_vol_type.properties) expected = { 'volume_type': 'name', 'provider': 'nova.Test', 'cipher': None, 'control_location': 'front-end', 'key_size': None } self.assertEqual(set(expected.keys()), set(reality.keys())) for key in expected: self.assertEqual(expected[key], reality[key])

subject: Workflow to setup validations
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-06 16:15:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common/commit/20ed3558d8ad1b103f0d244848cbf31d109859fb', 'message': 'Validations actions and workbook

This patch contains the bits to run Ansible TripleO validations with
Mistral.

It provides actions to list validations and validation groups, and run
a list of validations or groups of validations using ansible.

It contains an ansible dynamic inventory to use with TripleO
deployments that might be useful to others.

Change-Id: I93972b34186ac3aaf54fa6aebd14bf48b5247266
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-06 16:39:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common/commit/1d7b2bb2a06c3f86978d2b91bdc997377a25e4d0', 'message': 'Validations actions and workbook

This patch contains the bits to run Ansible TripleO validations with
Mistral.

It provides actions to list validations and validation groups, and run
a list of validations or groups of validations using ansible.

It contains an ansible dynamic inventory to use with TripleO

commit_message:
Workflow to setup validations

The new tripleo.validations.v1.copy_ssh_keys workflow copies the
provided public key to the overcloud nodes in preparation for running
ansible validations.

When no public key exists, a new one will be generated and stored in
a dedicated mistral environment.

Change-Id: I93972b34186ac3aaf54fa6aebd14bf48b5247266
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/32/313632/26 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash set -e VALIDATION_FILE=$1 if [[ -z "$VALIDATION_FILE" ]]; then echo "Missing required validation file" exit 1 fi if [[ ! -r "$VALIDATION_FILE" ]]; then echo "Can not find validation at $VALIDATION_FILE" exit 1 fi DYNAMIC_INVENTORY_SCRIPT=/usr/bin/tripleo-ansible-inventory.py source /home/stack/stackrc # Make sure ssh is not asking interactively for hosts it can't check the key # authenticity export ANSIBLE_HOST_KEY_CHECKING=False ansible-playbook -i $DYNAMIC_INVENTORY_SCRIPT $VALIDATION_FILE

subject: Create Instance from BuildRequest if not in a cell
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-05 22:04:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/015edf9b6e43f46ef6809e7b7fec3facad55f826', 'message': 'WIP Create Instance from BuildRequest if not in a cell

Rough PoC for what it might look like to get an Instance object for the
api if the instance has not yet been scheduled to a cell.  This would
not come into effect until instance creation was moved to be after
scheduling.

Change-Id: Ib984c30543acb3ca9cb95fb53d44d9ded0f5a5c8
Partially-implements: bp cells-scheduling-interaction
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-23 22:40:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/bf0206cabc577610d05bda1005b98a4d17171517', 'message': 'WIP Create Instance from BuildRequest if not in a cell

Rough PoC for what it might look like to get an Instance object for the
api if the instance has not yet been scheduled to a cell.  This would
not come into effect until instance creation was moved to be after
scheduling.

Change-Id: Ib984c30543acb3ca9cb95fb53d44d9ded0f5a5c8
Partially-implements: bp cells-scheduling-interaction
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-24 22:21:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/1e5d96e1908275d40ea1c43a7c9607d20eacd323', 'message': 'Create Instance from BuildRequest if not in a cell

This is preliminary work towards moving instance creation until after
scheduling. In order to do that we still need the ability to honor an
instance show request. This does a lookup to determine if an instance is
in a cell and if not it synthesizes an instance from the BuildRequest
object that has been stored.

If the instance is not mapped then the deployment has not migrated to
their first cell yet and the instance lookup proceeds as usual.

Until instance creation is actually moved until after scheduling this is
mostly a noop.

Honoring the instance list command will come later.

Change-Id: Ib984c30543acb3ca9cb95fb53d44d9ded0f5a5c8
Partially-implements: bp cells-scheduling-interaction
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-02-25 15:54:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/ab1d900ceb52e747fad63351ffa3cfff6c495f83', 'message': 'Create Instance from BuildRequest if not in a cell

object that has been stored.

If the instance is not mapped then the deployment has not migrated to
their first cell yet and the instance lookup proceeds as usual.

Until instance creation is actually moved until after scheduling this is
mostly a noop.

Honoring the instance list command will come later.

Change-Id: Ib984c30543acb3ca9cb95fb53d44d9ded0f5a5c8
Partially-implements: bp cells-scheduling-interaction

scheduling. In order to do that we still need the ability to honor an
instance show request. This does a lookup to determine if an instance is
in a cell and if not it synthesizes an instance from the BuildRequest
object that has been stored.

If the instance is not mapped then the deployment has not migrated to
their first cell yet and the instance lookup proceeds as usual.

Until instance creation is moved to after scheduling this is mostly a
noop.

Honoring the instance list command will come later.

Change-Id: Ib984c30543acb3ca9cb95fb53d44d9ded0f5a5c8
Partially-implements: bp add-buildrequest-obj
Partially-implements: bp cells-scheduling-interaction

commit_message:
Create Instance from BuildRequest if not in a cell

This is preliminary work towards moving instance creation until after
scheduling. In order to do that we still need the ability to honor an
instance show request. This does a lookup to determine if an instance is
in a cell and if not it synthesizes an instance from the BuildRequest
object that has been stored.

If the instance is not mapped then the deployment has not migrated to
their first cell yet and the instance lookup proceeds as usual.

Until instance creation is moved to after scheduling this is mostly a
noop.

Honoring the instance list command will come later.

Change-Id: Ib984c30543acb3ca9cb95fb53d44d9ded0f5a5c8
Partially-implements: bp add-buildrequest-obj
Partially-implements: bp cells-scheduling-interaction

commit_message:
Move os_gnocchi & os_magnum roles into the OSA deliverable

The Gnocchi and Magnum roles are included as part of the
OpenStack-Ansible integrated deliverable for the Newton
release. This patch moves the repository entries to reflect
this.

Change-Id: Ia37309a784ac97b8ff3e4f445addfdd2b2f68efa

commit_message:
Ironic: add missing haproxy and firewall configuration

Make sure Ironic API listens on a different IP than HAProxy.

Also open firewall ports for Ironic API and TFTP.

Change-Id: I9d843e76adcdb1085fd1e9fb7408a2387909382b

commit_message:
projects/puppet: add puppet-panko

Panko provides events functionality to Telemetry. This repo
contains specific configuration files, services, endpoints, etc.

It requires a new Puppet module to be created and be part of
Puppet OpenStack modules.

Depends-On: I4f3a6021eb14480357760d8f8a5d2dd28262b72e

Change-Id: Ia20e8534b93a8b295b2f6a07a87754663bd1d868

commit_message:
Customize "supported_pci_vendor_devs" for SR-IOV

Allows the operator to configure the NIC vendor’s product ID, if
it differs from the default supported NICs.

By default Intel & Mellanox SR-IOV capable NICs are supported

Change-Id: I9b49ae04cc292ed125eeef30033e566e8f849626
Implements: blueprint tripleo-sriov
Signed-off-by: karthik s <ksundara@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/35/327735/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: NeutronSupportedPCIVendorDevs: description: List of supported pci vendor devices in the format VendorID:ProductID. type: comma_delimited_list default: ['15b3:1004','8086:10ca'] NeutronSupportedPCIVendorDevs: {get_param: NeutronSupportedPCIVendorDevs}

required SR-IOV interfaces.

commit_message:
Fix building derived inputs from a derived config

The previous patch for this bug, bbb1dfb06e074dd6da285723393cea7cf419f9b7,
changed from using the previous software config to calculate the
previous inputs to using the previous derived config. Since the derived
config includes values, this caused an error when trying to initialise
the InputConfig objects in _build_derived_inputs(). That'd be easily
fixed, but it's probably overkill anyway now that we have the entire
derived config, so just use the stored values.

Change-Id: I7424df9a564d63eb197da93b16409149a4f37fdb
Closes-Bug: #1616550

commit_message:
Calculate MTU on every network fetch instead of on create

Today, existing networks may not reflect MTU configured for
neutron-server, if they were created when neutron-server was using
different MTU setup for its infrastructure, or when it was using bad
default values for network MTUs (specifically, before Mitaka, all networks
were getting MTU = 0 by default, disabling both advertisement and data
path MTU size enforcement).

This patch stops persisting MTU in the database on network create and
instead calculate it on every network resource fetch.

DocImpact Now changes to MTU configuration options immediately affect
          existing network MTUs, not just new networks.

UpgradeImpact Existing networks with invalid MTU persisted in database
              may change their MTU values to reflect configuration.

Conflicts:
	neutron/common/config.py
	neutron/db/db_base_plugin_v2.py
	neutron/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/CONTRACT_HEAD
	neutron/plugins/ml2/managers.py
	neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py

Mitaka changes:
- omitted alembic change, leaving mtu attribute in the database (the
  model won't load the attribute)

TODO: consider upgrade scenario with mixed server versions.

Change-Id: Iee4f5037bf10b73ba98464143b183aacb59c22f2
Closes-Bug: #1556182
(cherry picked from commit a984f9554cdcbe93c840a1d8f5c04302e9331e79)

added_lines: from neutron.extensions import multiprovidernet as mpnet def _get_network_mtu(self, network): mtus = [] try: segments = network[mpnet.SEGMENTS] except KeyError: segments = [network] for s in segments: segment_type = s[provider.NETWORK_TYPE] try: type_driver = self.type_manager.drivers[segment_type].obj except KeyError: # NOTE(ihrachys) This can happen when type driver is not loaded # for an existing segment. While it's probably an indication of # a bad setup, it's better to be safe than sorry here. Also, # several unit tests use non-existent driver types that may # trigger the exception here. LOG.warning( _LW("Failed to determine MTU for segment " "%(segment_type)s:%(segment_id)s; network " "%(network_id)s MTU calculation may be not accurate"), { 'segment_type': segment_type, 'segment_id': s[provider.SEGMENTATION_ID], 'network_id': network['id'], } ) else: mtu = type_driver.get_mtu(provider.PHYSICAL_NETWORK) # Some drivers, like 'local', may return None; the assumption # then is that for the segment type, MTU has no meaning or # unlimited, and so we should then ignore those values. if mtu: mtus.append(mtu) return min(mtus) if mtus else 0 result[api.MTU] = self._get_network_mtu(result) updated_network[api.MTU] = self._get_network_mtu(updated_network) result[api.MTU] = self._get_network_mtu(result) for net in nets: net[api.MTU] = self._get_network_mtu(net)
deleted_lines: from neutron.db import netmtu_db netmtu_db.Netmtu_db_mixin, if net_data.get(api.MTU, 0) > 0: net_db[api.MTU] = net_data[api.MTU] result[api.MTU] = net_data[api.MTU]

commit_message:
Rename lxc to lxd in various tasks

lxc has been replaced by lxd as the nova_virt_type.
This change fixes a few missed instances of the
variable.

Change-Id: I1f6c57393a4c1c351c1152e3355a5676be992544

commit_message:
Refactored sudo logic in SSHManager

Now, whether use sudo mode or not, "sudo" parameter
has to be passed to SSHManager methods with default state:
  do not change.
Process flag in context manager
  (flag will be reverted to the original state after command)
Default sudo mode settings could be changed by environment variables:
  ENV_FUEL_SUDO
  ENV_SLAVE_SUDO

Partial-Bug: #1566377

Change-Id: Id298a396867eae74a6d86ba370edd33040f15911
(cherry picked from commit 287ac3c)

because neutron package has correct /etc/sudoers.d/neutron file.

Closes-bug: #1615643

subject: Fix venv build error introduced in a822fc7
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-26 09:37:11.000000000', 'files': ['templates/op-venv-script.sh.j2'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-repo_build/commit/5a28792a98712585d02801540a7e192ddb51972d', 'message': "Fix venv build error introduced in a822fc7

The recent patch merged [1] had two errors:

1) The 'requires_pip_packages' list was taken as part of the list
   of packages which should go into the venv. This should not be
   the case as these packages go on to the host.

2) When looping through each list set of packages for the role, each
   list in turn would replace the last - therefore only the last set
   would be built into the venv.

This patch ensures that the 'requires_pip_packages' list is ignored
(along with the optional and proprietary lists) and also ensures that
each list processed that should be included is properly merged into
a consolidated list before executing the build.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/360406

Change-Id: I35ca4305803d55fdad23039851a25915b2cf0100
"}]
commit_message:
Fix venv build error introduced in a822fc7

The recent patch merged [1] had two errors:

1) The 'requires_pip_packages' list was taken as part of the list
   of packages which should go into the venv. This should not be
   the case as these packages go on to the host.

2) When looping through each list set of packages for the role, each
   list in turn would replace the last - therefore only the last set
   would be built into the venv.

This patch ensures that the 'requires_pip_packages' list is ignored
(along with the optional and proprietary lists) and also ensures that
each list processed that should be included is properly merged into
a consolidated list before executing the build.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/360406

Change-Id: I35ca4305803d55fdad23039851a25915b2cf0100
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-repo_build refs/changes/40/361040/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {% set requirement_list = [] %}{% if '_pip_packages' in requirement_key and 'requires' not in requirement_key and 'optional' not in requirement_key and 'proprietary' not in requirement_key %} {% for requirement in requirement_data %} {% set _ = requirement_list.append(requirement) %} {% endfor %}# venv to build {{ role_name }} # * packages within the {{ role_name }} venv: {{ requirement_list }} {% set _ = os_group.update({role_name: requirement_list}) %}
deleted_lines: {% if '_pip_packages' in requirement_key and 'optional' not in requirement_key and 'proprietary' not in requirement_key %} # venv to build {{ role_name }} # * packages within the {{ role_name }} venv: {{ requirement_data }} {% set _ = os_group.update({role_name: requirement_data}) %}

commit_message:
Fix MU update master node script

Key moments:
* fail "update-master-node.sh" execution on any error
* reload systemd units after package upgrade
* print current update "stage"
* small refactoring (comments, quotes, etc)

Closes-bug: #1616472
Closes-bug: #1616393

Change-Id: I105c16e313a47908bd90a51f6557498735aa8a42
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/43/360443/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: set -ex set -o pipefail # setup loggingLOGFILE="${LOGFILE:-/var/log/puppet/update_master_node.log}" echo "Master node update is <in progress> (log: ${LOGFILE} )" echo '<STAGE>: Packages...' # upgrade packages# systemd: load fresh units systemctl daemon-reload echo '<STAGE>: Puppet...' # re-apply puppet master node configuration echo '<STAGE>: Services...' # restart servicesassassind " echo "Restarting postgresql..." systemctl restart postgresql echo "Restarting ${service}..." systemctl restart "$service" echo; echo echo "Master node update is <successfully complete> (log: ${LOGFILE} )" exit 0
deleted_lines: set -x LOGFILE=${LOGFILE:-/var/log/puppet/update_master_node.log}echo 'Master node update is in progress' assassind" service postgresql restart echo "Restarting $service" systemctl restart $service

commit_message:
Improving logging procedure

At the end of fuel-migration process script performs syncing
fuel-migration.log before creating flag and we can not see is flag
created properly or not.
So procedure of flag creation was placed before final log sync.

Change-Id: Iabf768a3824947896024415533e3587365917a9f
Related-Bug: #1606298

commit_message:
Fix dnsmasq listen-address

We should only include listen-address in the dnsmasq configuration if it
is not empty. Previously we might end up with a blank listen-address if
it was set to ""

Change-Id: Ia555b49e98018bb3f1982877fd19868089c77d20
Closes-Bug: #1615250
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/70/359970/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <% if @listen_address && !@listen_address.empty? %>listen-address=<%= @listen_address %><% end %>

commit_message:
Adds exhange declaration on sender's side

When you send message to exchange which is not exist current
channel is closed and you need to reconnect. This is undesired.
Also this patch separate sending fanout message and call/cast
messages and don't raise exception if exchange doesn't exist
for fanout messages.

Change-Id: Ia556d0c1b219387892007925bb437664aaaccb69
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/41/284441/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: exchange = self._pika_engine.get_rpc_exchange_name( self._target.exchange ) if no_ack: cast_all_servers_exchange = ( self._pika_engine.get_cast_all_servers_exchange_name( self._target.exchange, self._target.topic ) ) self._pika_engine.declare_queue_binding_by_channel( channel=self._channel, exchange=cast_all_servers_exchange, queue=server_queue, routing_key="", exchange_type='fanout', queue_expiration=queue_expiration, durable=False )
deleted_lines: exchange = self._pika_engine.get_rpc_exchange_name( self._target.exchange, self._target.topic, False, no_ack ) fanout_exchange = self._pika_engine.get_rpc_exchange_name( self._target.exchange, self._target.topic, True, no_ack ) self._pika_engine.declare_queue_binding_by_channel( channel=self._channel, exchange=fanout_exchange, queue=server_queue, routing_key="", exchange_type='fanout', queue_expiration=queue_expiration, durable=False )

commit_message:
Added todo for deletion LiveMigrateData.detect_implementation usage

Since Mitaka LiveMigrateData object is used during rpc, so it's
possible to remove it safely on RPC version bump to 5.x
This patch adds todo notes for that

Change-Id: I9baa98bfc3365ee9b431970966fee88512a03114

commit_message:
Make sure vif-plugin event can be sent to correct host when evacuating

1.Update the launched_on of instance objects when evacuating.
2.Using instance.launched_on replace the instance.host because
we need to send vif-plugin event messaging to host which vms
running on.

Change-Id: I0256ace86985235057b99165d4d26dee3b7e2728
Signed-off-by: zhangjl <zhangjl@awcloud.com>
Close-Bug: #1612891
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/43/355843/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: instance.launched_on = self.host instance.save()

TrivialFix: Remove cfg import unused

This patch removes cfg import unused in
tempest/api/object_storage/test_container_quotas.py
and tempest/api/object_storage/test_object_temp_url.py

commit_message:
XenAPI: failed to poll cpu_util

VM_metrics is obsoleted, which will fail the polling on meter of
cpu_util. This commit will fix it with other APIs.

Change-Id: I3b87f5a5780e21366549f6daae7d8afdb1608f27
Related-bug: 1614874
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/76/357676/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: vcpus_number = int(self._call_xenapi("VM.get_VCPUs_max", vm_ref)) if vcpus_number <= 0: msg = _("Could not get VM %s CPU number") % instance_name for index in range(vcpus_number): utils += self._call_xenapi("VM.query_data_source", vm_ref, "cpu%d" % index)
deleted_lines: metrics_ref = self._call_xenapi("VM.get_metrics", vm_ref) metrics_rec = self._call_xenapi("VM_metrics.get_record", metrics_ref) vcpus_number = metrics_rec['VCPUs_number'] vcpus_utils = metrics_rec['VCPUs_utilisation'] if len(vcpus_utils) == 0: msg = _("Could not get VM %s CPU Utilization") % instance_name for num in range(int(vcpus_number)): utils += vcpus_utils.get(str(num))

commit_message:
Fix aws_conf generation

[service_available] isn't being generated. This patch fixes it.

Closes-Bug: #1613542
Change-Id: I11fa417e6f2353565f34c480930aedc66a026b1d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ec2-api refs/changes/24/357824/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return [ (aws_config.aws_group.name, config.AWSGroup) ('service_available', aws_config.ServiceAvailableGroup) ]
